WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! :)
Lifting feels great. Stress relief, escape from reality, knowing you've at progress, however small it is. Keep going bro 3

Yeah the hardest bit was just getting started! I made it a routine and eventually it became habit. Some days my workout didn't feel like it did much. But then I was told the only workout that's bad, is the one you didn't do. Keep going mate, and thank you
Thank you!
Yeahhhhh boiiiiiii! Thanks!

It's all about the little steps. A few more calories, a few more fork fulls of whatever. The hardest thing for me was loving myself. I felt envious of everyone for being "normal" and having weight. One day I realised that me and my body are on the same team, so we started acting like one. Good on you man, proud of you!
Thank you! Definitely will keep it up :) this is just the start. Everyone on here has been wonderful so far, we can all hit our aims together!
Thanks dude! Hopefully it keeps getting better!

Thank you! 3 I think a lot of mental health issues all men suffer with are a stigma. There's the whole concept men are meant to be strong and we are somewhat immune to mental illness so it's looked down on. I still get the looks when I talk about it today! Hopefully this post helps though, everyone has been amazing in this subreddit! Thank you again!
Thank you my friend, I'll keep working hard!

Thank you! It took me a while to post mainly because I hate looking at the first picture. It's a mix of shame and embarrassment. Eventually I came to realise that it's me, regardless. And that's nothing to be ashamed about!
It's still sinking in every time I see myself but rest assured, I'll believe I'm not one day! Thanks bro 3
Thank you! :)

One reason I posted this is because I lurked for a long time without posting, and I wouldn't have been alone. Hopefully others in similar situations to me can realise they can do whatever their aims are too! Thank you :)
Reading and seeing everyone's progress in /r/fitness is what helped me get through it, that's why I love it too! Thanks man :)

Thanks dude! I lived a long time telling myself I couldn't do things. It got to the point I told myself I couldn't do things I hadn't even tried, to protect myself incase I failed. I guess one day I stopped and said "why can't I?" And it all stemmed from there!
Thank you for the kind words
Only way to get where we all want to be, is to be positive mate! Thank you!
Well we can do this together man, we got this! Thanks for the compliment! 3
Much appreciated friend, this is why I love Reddit!
HOOLLLLAAAAA
Thank you!
I've had laser eye surgery since that picture, so no glasses. Also no longer have a fringe so I will look very different!

My biggest problem trying to tell people now is telling them I was anorexic as the stigma is only women tend to suffer with it, so thanks for the kind words my friend. Means a lot! 3
I'll make sure to post it over on /r/progresspics after work too!
Thank you! Proud of myself! Can join you guys on the road to fitness now :)
I cannot actually remember a time I've been this happy man, thank you! 3
